comments.body: /effect @s(or whoever you want) instant_health 1 255
Um.... That is kind of /effect @s regeneration
/effect [@a/@s/@p/@e/playername] instant_health [seconds] [strength]
THis will be great for newbies but It would make minecraft more easier. So it has its ups and downs
This is a good idea, but it might not happen because there is a command that does this already: /effect give @p minecraft:instant_healing 1 50

This would just be an alias for /effect give <target> minecraft:instant_health <duration> <amplifier>
...

Sounds like a good idea

 

  •
/effect give @s minecraft:instant_health 1 10 true

I think this would be more useful if you could make it heal a specific amount.

  • '/heal' on its own heals you to full.
  • '/heal [player]' heals the target to full.
  • '/heal [player] <amount>' heals the target for a specific amount of half-hearts.

Additionally, a /damage command that works in a similar way would be good too. Alternatively, a negative value put in the /heal command you just damage you instead. Either way, it would allow map makers and data pack makers to control the player's health more easily.
Maybe a command similar to /heal <target> <amount> would be useful for something like lifesteal.
It's a good idea

I think it should be /summon beacon_beam and then place glass on it to change its color. But if you want it so it Change color without glass then maybe you could do /summon beacon_beam {“Color{“blue”} or something like that. But for bedrock they could do /summon beacon_beam minecraft:color_red.

I think a cool way to implement this would be with a /movement command 

it would work like this 

/movement [ENTITY] [CORDS] [SPEED]

/movement @e[type=sheep,limit=1,sort=nearest]  ~ ~-1 ~  2

or to make a player move in the direction their looking

execute as @a[tag=fly,predicate=namespace:sneak] at @s run movement @s ^ ^ ^1 3

it wouldn't let entities move through blocks unless they're in spectator mode or something

this would also be really useful for creating projectiles in datapacks!!

But yes, +1 on this for sure.  This would make minigame making so much better and more fun.

I totally agree with you.

More than once, someone on multiplayer has done something bad or annoying (I've even encountered a hacker on my survival world), and I wish I could just remove them permanently. But I can't because I don't have java, and there's no /ban command on other platforms!
If you hold shift while middle-clicking blocks, their NBT data is stored. I would assume the same goes for entities
392665032771 You mean CTRL, not Shift, right?

This would be very useful as it would allow for datapacks to affect things on a per-biome basis and would vastly increase the amounts of possibilities with datapacks.  I've been working on a datapack that spawns new structures in the world and detecting biomes is so extremely limited and inefficient as the best method I can use right now is a massive amount of commands to take a sampling of nearby tiles to get an "idea" of what biome it might be in.

Whether it be through nbt or target selectors whichever method would be way better than anything we have for it right now as even the advancement hack is extremely limited due to how slowly it updates (only once per second) and the inability to use it with other entities.
This would seriously help creators, surprised it isn’t already in the game honestly as it’s such a pivotal use

scoreboard players operation temp Temp = @s speed

scoreboard players operation @e speed -= temp Temp

kill @e[score={speed=0}]

scoreboard players operation @e speed += temp Temp

It's a bit longer but functional ;)

Yes but this system needs to be a loop if there are many entities. The example I gave on the post isn't the best. Here is a better :

A system that teleports bats with a score of "menthe" to the witch that has the same score of "menthe".

Your system works but if the teleportation has to be very fast, it needs to be a loop. So a single command would be more effective and cause less lag, since minecraft doesn't have to execute 4 commands for each entitiy targeted by the command.

Yeah a command like this except it's just it's own command like /scoreboard players compare @p obj1 @p obj2, this would compare two specified players/entitys, and if there values are the same the command block will activates (for conditional command chains or Redstone output)

On bedrock, an example for the command would be:

/effect @a[scores={*OBJECTIVE NAME*=*VALUE*}]

the words in * are custom (u have to do those, idk what u have)

I think it should keep original ".." to set up mix and max value.
Just like "[scores={test="selector":"%%1".."selector":%%2"}]
if "%%1" and "%%2" are the same person, the value is the same, too.

This would be a good thing to add in game. Maybe there could be an "isLooped" condition for the command. You could set this to either true or false. Just some thoughts!
We need sound detection too. Part of an execute command or something. It  would just be nice to check for sounds and sound channels.

We understand that music and sounds are client-side, but even so playing music could be stored and read as an nbt in each player. That way sounds could easily be detected per player even if players are using resource packs that make sounds longer or shorter. This would help adventure maps improve their quality SO much as well as games on servers
This would require quite the rework, as this is actually controlled by block states, and not a global thing.

They did something known as "the flattening" in 1.13, in short, there was a 256 block limit hardcoded into the game due to ID's being based off a number that only went up to 256. So to work around this they added damage values to blocks, like andesite granite, and diorite. In 1.13 they changed the ID system to work off of strings instead and because of the new limit being basically endless they decided to completely remove having the same block being able to be different because of a damage value, so instead of diorite or andesite being stone/1 or stone/2, they were their own ID's. the reason why that command isn't working is that they changed the system. Now it is its own block, the petrified oak slab.

 

TL;DR

the command is this, because technical stuff, and this is absolutely not the right place to post about this.

/give @s minecraft:petrified_oak_slab 1

if you don't know what you are doing I recommend you use https://mcstacker.net/1.13converter.php, they have a very good command generator that's pretty intuitive.

This is very replaceable as you can always set an mob's Owner NBT to the UUID of the player that you want to protect. not all mobs of course, only the ones that do support the Owner NBT tag, like wolves, horses, lightning bolts, fireballs, wind charges etc...
